net.proteusframework.data.filesystem

Class FileSystemDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.DAOHelper
      • net.proteusframework.data.filesystem.FileSystemDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InitializingBean

    @Repository(value="fileSystemProcessor")
public class FileSystemDAO
extends net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.dao.DAOHelper

    Defines operations for a filesystem that is designed for storing and serving HTTP content from multiple servers. The file system hierarchy and meta data is stored in a RDMS, the data streams many be stored in several storage modules per file or directory.

    • Two entities with the same parent entity and name may not exist with a non-null trash time.
    • Permission protection is not enforced by implementations except where a method contract dictates otherwise. It is the responsibility of the calling code.

    Trash can: Any entity may be placed in the trash can by having the trashed property set to true. Multiple entities with the same parent and name may exist in the trash can. This applies to all entities, file, directory, meta data, etc.

    Make sure your application has registered FileSystemEntityPostDeleteEventListener with your hibernate configuration.

    TODO (double@i2rd.com) : Add a flag to the constructor to indicate if permission control should be enforced in this implementation or let the caller check permissions. We should have two instances of the DAO, one with permission control and one without for situations in which the operations are triggered by the system rather than by the user.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

        Throws:
        IOException - on error.

      • changeStorage

        public void changeStorage(StreamStorage newStorage,
                 Collection<FileSystemEntity> fseList,
                 net.proteusframework.users.model.Principal initator,
                 boolean moveExisting)
                   throws IOException

        Change the stream storage module for a collection of file system entities. This method may return before the operation is complete, assuming the operation is scheduled to occur later. The performance of the operation per entity must be atomic such that requesting the data for an entity will return valid data at all times.

        Changing the stream storage module for a directory controls where new streams are stored. If the moveExisting argument is true then all files in the hierarchy rooted at the directory will be moved to the new module. If said argument is false, existing file storage is not changed but new files will be stored with the new module.

        Changing the stream storage module for a file changes only where that particular file's stream is stored. Again, this operation may be immediate or scheduled depending on the implementation.

        This implementation makes directory modifications immediately and schedules changing for files at a later time. The scheduling affects both files passed in the fseList explicitly and files implicitly specified by a directory and the moveExisting argument being true.

        If the initiator has a preferred email address then an email will be sent on the completion or failure of the operation to the initiator.

        Parameters:
        newStorage - the new storage module for the entities.
        fseList - the list of entities to change, if any entity is already using the module then no change will be done for that file.
        initator - the principal initiating the change.
        moveExisting - true to move existing files in DirectoryEntity objects to the new storage module, false to leave existing files alone.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • changeStorage

        public void changeStorage(StreamStorage storage,
                 FileEntity file)
                   throws IOException
        Move the data for the file to another stream storage module. Use of this method is discouraged, use changeStorage(StreamStorage, Collection, Principal, boolean) if possible. This method will block until the data is moved and may take a long time. When this method returns, the data must be completely moved to the new storage module. Care must be taken such that requests for the file data will be successful during the move operation.
        Parameters:
        storage - the new storage module.
        file - the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • changeStorage

        public void changeStorage(StreamStorage storage,
                 FileEntity file,
                 boolean forceUncompressed)
                   throws IOException
        Move the data for the file to another stream storage module. Use of this method is discouraged, use changeStorage(StreamStorage, Collection, Principal, boolean) if possible. This method will block until the data is moved and may take a long time. When this method returns, the data must be completely moved to the new storage module. Care must be taken such that requests for the file data will be successful during the move operation.
        Parameters:
        storage - the new storage module.
        forceUncompressed - Cause the stream to be stored in uncompressed format in the new storage module even if it normally would be compressed.
        file - the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

        public void deletePermanently(FileSystemEntity entity)
                       throws IOException

        Parameters:

      • getAncestorDirectory

        public DirectoryEntity getAncestorDirectory(FileSystemEntity fse)
        Get the ancestor of the specified file system entity that is a directory. This is typically the parent, but may be several levels up in the hierarchy if the specified entity is a revision file or a file with a file as a child. If the specified entity is a root directory, then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        fse - the file system entity. May be null.
        Returns:
        the parent or null if the specified entity has no ancestor that is a directory. The returned entity is narrowed.

      • getAvailableStreamStorageForRoot

        public Collection<StreamStorage> getAvailableStreamStorageForRoot(FileSystemEntity root)
                                                           throws IOException
        Get the available stream storage modules for the root, or the root of the argument if the argument is not a root. There should always be at least one stream storage module available.
        Parameters:
        root - the root directory.
        Returns:
        the stream storage modules, at least one, never null or zero.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • grantCapabilities

        public void grantCapabilities(FileSystemEntity entity,
                     net.proteusframework.users.model.Principal principal,
                     EnumSet<FileSystemEntityCapabilityOperation> ops)
                       throws IOException
        Grant capabilities to a PrincipalGroup for a FileSystemEntity. Checks if the group already has the capabilities before assigning. If the file entity references another entity for where the protection settings (capabilies) are defined, then the capability will be granted to the other entity; this can significantly increase the scope of the granted capability.

        This applies to the specified entity's protection - not the entity itself. As a result, these changes may apply to other files / directories.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to grant capabilities for. This entity must be persistent or hibernate exception will occur.
        principal - the principal to grant capabilities to, must not be transient.
        ops - the operations to grant, must not be null but if empty the will be a no-op
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs.

      • grantCapabilities

        public void grantCapabilities(FileSystemEntity entity,
                     net.proteusframework.users.model.PrincipalGroup group,
                     EnumSet<FileSystemEntityCapabilityOperation> ops)
                       throws IOException
        Grant capabilities to a PrincipalGroup for a FileSystemEntity. Checks if the group already has the capabilities before assigning. If the file entity references another entity for where the protection settings (capabilies) are defined, then the capability will be granted to the other entity; this can significantly increase the scope of the granted capability.

        This applies to the specified entity's protection - not the entity itself. As a result, these changes may apply to other files / directories.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to grant capabilities for. This entity must be persistent or hibernate exception will occur.
        group - the principal group to grant capabilities to, must not be transient.
        ops - the operations to grant, must not be null but if empty the will be a no-op
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs.

        Returns:

      • isProtected

        public boolean isProtected(FileSystemEntity fse,
                  FileSystemEntityCapabilityOperation op)
        Check to see if a file has any capabilities for the specified operation. If not, then the file is unprotected for that operation. Do not assume that the protection (or lack of) of one operation implies the protection (or lack of) another. If a file is unprotected for Read, that does not mean it is unprotected for Write.
        Parameters:
        fse - the file
        op - optional data operation.
        Returns:
        true if it's protected, false if not

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot(FileSystemEntity fse)
        Test if the specified FileSystemEntity is a root directory.
        Parameters:
        fse - the entity.
        Returns:
        true or false.

        Parameters:

        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • newFile

        public FileEntity newFile(FileSystemEntity parent,
                 FileEntity file,
                 FileSystemEntityCreateMode mode)
                   throws IOException
        Create a new file. If the specified file is a TemporaryFileEntity, then setStream(FileEntity, InputStream) will automatically be called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent entity.
        file - the file.
        mode - the create mode for the specified FileEntity.
        Returns:
        the new File. This may be different than the specified file if the create mode is replacement; otherwise, it will be the same file specified.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • queryChildren

        public Collection<FileSystemEntity> queryChildren(FileSystemEntity parent,
                                         @Nullable
                                         FileSystemEntityFilter filter)
                                           throws IOException
        Query for child objects. This method does not return trashed entities.
        Parameters:
        parent - the root to query.
        filter - optional filter, it is recommended to use the FilterUtil class to create the filter as the implementation may be able to optimize filtering.
        Returns:
        Collection of (hibernate narrowed) non meta data entities.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • queryChildren

        public Collection<FileSystemEntity> queryChildren(FileSystemEntity parent,
                                         FileSystemEntityFilter filter,
                                         FileSystemEntityCapabilityOperation operation)
                                           throws IOException
        Query for child objects. This method does not return trashed entities.
        Parameters:
        parent - the root to query.
        filter - optional filter, it is recommended to use the FilterUtil class to create the filter as the implementation may be able to optimize filtering.
        operation - operation to check for each entity returned.
        Returns:
        Collection of (hibernate narrowed) non meta data entities.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

            String name)
              throws IOException

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity.
        name - the new name.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs or a FileEntity already exists with the specified name.

      • setStream

        public void setStream(FileEntity file,
             InputStream stream)
               throws IOException
        Set the stream for the file and update any metadata. Note for implementors: the compression property in FileEntity must be set before sending the stream to the StreamStorage module so that the module implementation knows if the stream is being compressed. This will automatically update the modification info.
        Parameters:
        file - the file.
        stream - the stream. Closes stream when finished.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • setStream

        public void setStream(FileEntity file,
             InputStream stream,
             boolean updateModInfo)
               throws IOException
        Set the stream for the file and update any metadata. Note for implementors: the compression property in FileEntity must be set before sending the stream to the StreamStorage module so that the module implementation knows if the stream is being compressed.
        Parameters:
        file - the file.
        stream - the stream. Closes stream when finished.
        updateModInfo - flag to update the modtime and moduser.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • walkDownPath

        public void walkDownPath(FileSystemEntity leaf,
                Function<FileSystemEntity,Boolean> function)
        Walks down the path to the specified FileSystemEntity unless the specified function returns false for an element in the path.
        Parameters:
        leaf - the leaf.
        function - the function to call for each element in the path. The function should return false to stop walking the path. The passed FileSystemEntity has been narrowed.

      • walkUpPath

        public void walkUpPath(FileSystemEntity leaf,
              Function<FileSystemEntity,Boolean> function)
        Walks up the path of a FileSystemEntity unless the specified function returns false for an element in the path.
        Parameters:
        leaf - the leaf.
        function - the function to call for each element in the path. The function should return false to stop walking the path. The passed FileSystemEntity has been narrowed.
